column4: shadow_x: yes!  what program do you want to use the samba share from?
i'd really like to be able to access the share from anything
i'll be using wine-installed apps to access them, as well as various programs within my local system itself
its not working
what have you done so far?
but you did see your stuff when you ran smbclient, right?
correct. i already have the samba shares mounted on my desktop as network servers. however, i need them mounted within the local filesystem as other devices would be
can you paste the exact command that you tried in here?  the mount -t command?
and the message it returned?
something is strange then.  stupid question: what does "which mount" return?
can you do a paste at http://pastebin.ubuntu.com/ with your shell output?  blank out the password, but paste in everything you typed and all the responses.
odd, now its denying me access to mounting
paste it in the pastebin, reply with the url
http://pastebin.ubuntu.com/8186/
rough.  looks like windows is denying the connection.  try the smbclient again, see what it does.
why are you using samba to share then?
it's a whole lot easier to share stuff over scp or something like that than over samba
because i have a windows workstation that i use for production purposes, and need access to my fileserve, which is running Debian
gotcha
you're gonna have to figure out why the smb connection isn't working...it'll probably be a combination of checking the smb logs on the server and output from smbclient on the client
thanks
